dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, hey, did you see this story coming out of Semey? It's, uh, pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, hey, did you see this story coming out of Semey? It's, uh, pretty wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the bus incident? Yeah, I just caught the headline. Someone got arrested, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the bus incident? Yeah, I just caught the headline. Someone got arrested, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A passenger was sentenced to 20 days of administrative arrest following a conflict with a bus driver in Semey. The offender was detained the same day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Arrested and sentenced, actually. Twenty days of administrative arrest for, um, a bus passenger.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Arrested and sentenced, actually. Twenty days of administrative arrest for, um, a bus passenger.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A passenger was sentenced to 20 days of administrative arrest following a conflict with a bus driver in Semey.

dialogue_turns.text: Twenty days? Wow. What on earth did they do? Like, was it just a fare dispute or something?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twenty days? Wow. What on earth did they do? Like, was it just a fare dispute or something?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, way worse. The article says it was a conflict with the bus driver, and get this, it was all caught on video by eyewitnesses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, way worse. The article says it was a conflict with the bus driver, and get this, it was all caught on video by eyewitnesses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A passenger was sentenced to 20 days of administrative arrest following a conflict with a bus driver in Semey. The incident was caught on video by eyewitnesses...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, of course it was. Everything's on video these days. But what did the video show?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, of course it was. Everything's on video these days. But what did the video show?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently, it showed the passenger *striking* the driver of a *moving* bus.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently, it showed the passenger striking the driver of a moving bus.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The incident was caught on video by eyewitnesses, showing the passenger striking the driver of a moving bus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A moving bus?! Are you serious? That's, uh, incredibly dangerous. Not just for the driver but for everyone on board.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A moving bus?! Are you serious? That's, uh, incredibly dangerous. Not just for the driver but for everyone on board.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The guy was detained the same day, thankfully.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The guy was detained the same day, thankfully.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The offender was detained the same day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, what was the charge? Assault?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what was the charge? Assault?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, it was under Part 2 of Article 434 of the Code of Administrative Offenses. They're calling it petty hooliganism. He, like, used obscene language.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, it was under Part two of Article four hundred thirty four of the Code of Administrative Offenses. They're calling it petty hooliganism. He, like, used obscene language.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The court reviewed the case under Part 2 of Article 434 of the Code of Administrative Offenses (CoAO), concerning petty hooliganism. Authorities determined that citizen I. used obscene language toward the driver during an argument on bus No. 2.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Obscene language, striking a driver on a moving bus... that sounds a bit more than "petty" to me.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Obscene language, striking a driver on a moving bus... that sounds a bit more than petty to me.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he partially admitted guilt, you know, acknowledging he disturbed public order.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he partially admitted guilt, you know, acknowledging he disturbed public order.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In court, he partially admitted guilt and acknowledged disturbing public order.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, there's more? Uh-oh.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, there's more? Uh-oh.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, this isn't his first rodeo. He'd *already* faced administrative charges in early June for, uh, "violating rules of conduct at sports, mass cultural, and entertainment events."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, this isn't his first rodeo. He'd already faced administrative charges in early June for, uh, violating rules of conduct at sports, mass cultural, and entertainment events.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It was also revealed that the same individual had already faced administrative charges in early June under Part 1 of Article 434 of the CoAO for "violating rules of conduct at sports, mass cultural, and entertainment events."

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No way! So, he's a repeat offender then? That explains the "Part 2" charge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No way! So, he's a repeat offender then? That explains the Part two charge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "Part 2 of Article 434 of the CoAO provides for administrative liability for obscene language in public places, offensive harassment of individuals, and other actions showing disrespect for others and disturbing public order"committed repeatedly within a year after a prior administrative penalty.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. Part 2 is for, like, repeated offenses within a year. So, this guy has a history of, uh, public outbursts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. Part two is for, like, repeated offenses within a year. So, this guy has a history of, uh, public outbursts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "Part 2 of Article 434 of the CoAO provides for administrative liability for ... committed repeatedly within a year after a prior administrative penalty.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And the video, it really showed him getting aggressive?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And the video, it really showed him getting aggressive?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a man in a black baseball cap, yelling aggressively at the driver. Passengers were, like, trying to calm him down. And then, uh, outside the bus, making obscene gestures.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a man in a black baseball cap, yelling aggressively at the driver. Passengers were, like, trying to calm him down. And then, uh, outside the bus, making obscene gestures.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The footage shows a man in a black baseball cap yelling aggressively at the driver, while nearby passengers try to calm him down. In the next frame, the offender is seen standing outside, making obscene gestures.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, a full-on public meltdown. I mean, 20 days, it, uh, seems pretty fair for that kind of behavior, especially on public transport.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, a full-on public meltdown. I mean, twenty days, it, uh, seems pretty fair for that kind of behavior, especially on public transport.

dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Though the court's decision, um, hasn't actually entered into legal force yet. So, we'll see what happens.
